items.title: Tanzania's Zanzibar steps up schistosomiasis screening to protect school children
items.summary: DAR ES SALAAM, Aug. 30 (Xinhua) -- Tanzania's Zanzibar on Saturday launched a major initiative to strengthen the fight against urinary schistosomiasis among school-age children, with the third batch of Chinese experts for the second phase of the China-aided schistosomiasis control project conducting a training session on Pemba Island. Read full story

items.title: UK police arrest five in London during anti-asylum protest
items.summary: LONDON (Reuters) -British police said they arrested five people on Saturday after masked men tried to force their way into a hotel used by asylum-seekers, a day after the government won a court ruling on the use of another hotel to house migrants. Read full story

items.title: Houthis confirm their prime minister killed in Israeli strike
items.summary: Ahmed Ghaleb Nasser al-Rahawi and several other Houthi officials were killed in the attack, the Iran-backed movement says.

items.title: No, a Windows update probably didn’t brick your SSD
items.summary: For the last week or two, reports have been circulating that recent Windows 11 updates (specifically KB5063878 and KB5062660) were causing some SSDs using Phison controllers to fail. Tech influencers on YouTube and TikTok were quick to jump on the reports of corrupted data and disappearing drives, laying the blame squarely at Microsoft’s feet. We’re […]

items.title: Namibia vows to bridge rural gaps in water, roads, digital access
items.summary: WINDHOEK, Aug. 30 (Xinhua) -- Namibian Prime Minister Elijah Ngurare on Saturday pledged to accelerate efforts to address rural development challenges, including lack of clean water, feeder roads, and digital connectivity, as part of the government's commitment to building a more inclusive nation. Read full story

items.title: Taco Bell is having second thoughts about relying on AI at the drive-through
items.summary: Taco Bell has apparently rolled out voice AI-powered ordering at more than 500 drive-throughs, leading to unflattering viral moments like someone ordering 18,000 water cups in order to “bypass” the AI and get connected to a human server.

items.title: 1st LD-Writethru: China opposes U.S. removal of semiconductor firms from validated end-user list
items.summary: BEIJING, Aug. 30 (Xinhua) -- China's Ministry of Commerce on Saturday voiced opposition to the U.S. decision to revoke the "validated end-user" (VEU) authorization for three semiconductor companies operating in China, urging the U.S. side to immediately correct its wrongdoings. Read full story

items.title: Prominent Ukrainian politician Andriy Parubiy shot dead in Lviv
items.summary: President Zelensky said the killing of Parubiy was a "terrible murder" - with a manhunt under way.

items.title: Merz promises debt relief for municipalities ahead of electoral test
items.summary: BONN, Germany (Reuters) -Germany's federal government will begin helping municipalities to pay down old debts from January 1, 2026, Chancellor Friedrich Merz said on Saturday, two weeks before his government faces its first electoral test since taking office. Read full story

items.title: 3 killed, 94 injured in train accident in NW Egypt
items.summary: CAIRO, Aug. 30 (Xinhua) -- Three people were killed and 94 others injured after a train derailed in Egypt's northwestern Matrouh governorate, the Health Ministry said Saturday. Read full story

items.title: TikTok suspends its live feature for the "next few days" in Indonesia, citing "increasing violence in protests" over lawmakers' pay (Stefanno Sulaiman/Reuters)
items.summary:
Stefanno Sulaiman / Reuters:
TikTok suspends its live feature for the “next few days” in Indonesia, citing “increasing violence in protests” over lawmakers' pay  —  ByteDance's TikTok has suspended its live feature for the “next few days” in Indonesia following protests in the country, its spokesperson said in a statement on Saturday.

items.title: EU to work on using frozen Russian assets to aid Ukraine after war
items.summary: COPENHAGEN (Reuters) -The European Union will examine how to use frozen Russian assets to fund Ukraine's defence and reconstruction after the war but confiscating them now is not politically realistic, EU foreign policy chief Kaja Kallas said on Saturday. Read full story

items.title: Pentarama Merdeka@HOHO tour performance captivates early arrivals in Putrajaya for National Day
items.summary: PUTRAJAYA: The National Day 2025 celebrations kicked off with excitement as the Pentarama Merdeka@HOHO performance, featuring the KL Hop On Hop Off (HOHO) buses, captivated visitors at two stops - the Dorsett Hotel and Dataran Putrajaya on Saturday (Aug 30) night. Read full story

items.title: Why the rush to call up Pahang MCA Youth chief on a holiday weekend, Dr Wee asks MCMC
items.summary: PETALING JAYA: Pahang MCA Youth chief Wong Siew Mun has been summoned at the eleventh hour to give a statement at the Malaysian Communications and Multimedia Commission (MCMC) headquarters in Cyberjaya on Sunday (Aug 31), says Datuk Seri Dr Wee Ka Siong. Read full story

items.summary: Russia hits 14 Ukrainian regions, Kyiv says, with at least one person reported killed and 30 injured.

items.title: Engineer killed in collision with tanker truck on PLUS Highway

Buy for $39.50 (Reg. $65)

Apply code PZC7INDL during checkout

What we love

This hub differentiates itself with a built-in storage compartment for various cables and adapters. Inside you’ll find a USB-C cable as well as Lightning and microUSB adapters. There’s even an SIM tray removal tool and a slot for a spare SIM card. In terms of I/O, you’ll have Ethernet, USB-A, Type-C, HDMI, as well as microSD and full-size SD card slots.

items.title: Uber and Lyft drivers in California win a path to unionization
